DataManipulation

Class Books

  • java.lang.Object
    • DataManipulation.Books

  • public class Books
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles all book related actions and information. It initializes objects, and set up parameters and arguments.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Books()
      Book constructor with no-arguments.
      Books(long isbn)
      Book constructor with one argument; used for searches.
      Books(long isbn, int copies)
      Book constructor with arguments; used for specific tasks as increasing or decreasing book quantity.
      Books(long isbn, java.lang.String bookTitle, java.lang.String publicationYear, int numberOfCopies, java.lang.String author)
      Book constructor with arguments; used to initialized a new book to be added to the data base.

        bookTitle - the books title.
        publicationYear - publication year of the book.
        numberOfCopies - number of copies avaliable.

      • searchBook

        public int searchBook(long isbn)
               throws java.sql.SQLException
        Gets the isbn from mainWindowController to use it as a parameter in the SQL statement which looks for the book with that isbn number. If a match is found, it returns a 1 meaning is true, or a 0 if it did not found a match.
        Parameters:
        isbn - the books isbn number.
        Returns:
        an integer specifying if a book was found in the database.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if there is an error communicating with the database.

      • decreasedCopies

        public void decreasedCopies()
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Decreases the number of avaliable books in the database.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if there is an error communicating with the database.

      • increasedCopies

        public void increasedCopies()
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Increases the number of books avaliable in the database.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if there is an error communicating with the database.
